statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \cos ^4 2 x \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.reason: \text{Applied the trigonometric identity, }\\ \cos 2x = 2 \cos^2 x -1 \\ \text{Check your calculations, if you got something}\\ \text{else.}

step.context: \text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ \int \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 8x +2 \cos 4x \right] \,dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.tex:
\int \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 8x +2 \cos 4x \right] \,dx \\ = \dfrac{1}{4}\int \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 8x +2 \cos 4x \right] \,dx \\
= \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac {3x} {2}+ \dfrac{1}{2} \left( \dfrac{\sin 8x }{8} \right) + \dfrac{2 \sin 4 x}{4} \right] + C \\
= \dfrac {3 x} {8} + \dfrac{1}{64}{\sin 8 x} + \dfrac{1}{8}{\sin 4 x}+ C

\int \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 8x +2 \cos 4x \right] \,dx \\ = \dfrac{1}{4}\int \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 8x +2 \cos 4x \right] \,dx \\
= \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac {3x} {2}- \dfrac{1}{2} \left( \dfrac{\sin 8x }{8} \right) - \dfrac{2 \sin 4 x}{4} \right] + C \\
= \dfrac {3 x} {8} - \dfrac{1}{64}{\sin 8 x} - \dfrac{1}{8}{\sin 4 x}+ C
step.reason: \int \cos (a x)dx = \dfrac{\sin (a x)}{a}+ C \\ \text{where C is the constant of integration.}
